full_summary:
# Supplemental Maintenance Program - Code Compliance Inspections, Testing, and Maintenance

## Background

Parks Canada is seeking the services of a contractor to perform code compliance inspections, testing, and maintenance for mechanical, electrical, potable water systems, communication towers, and other related systems in various regions across Canada. This is a major operational requirement to ensure a safe and efficient Park System management.

## Summary of Requirements

The selected contractor will be responsible for performing the following tasks:

* Inspect and test mechanical, electrical, and water systems to ensure compliance with National Model Codes and applicable standards.
* Perform minor repairs as required.
* Obtain certification of inspections to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
* The period of the contract is from the date of contract signature to February 28, 2024.

## Regions Affected

The contract will be divided into seven (7) regions:

* A - Atlantic
* B - Quebec
* C - Ontario and Waterways
* D - Prairies (Saskatchewan + Manitoba)
* E - Alberta
* F - British Columbia
* G - Yukon and Northwest Territories

## Submission Instructions

* Bids can be submitted in either official language (English or French).
* Bids can be submitted by fax or email.
* For security reasons, we do not accept bids sent directly to the contracting authority or any other email address except: soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca.
* The only acceptable fax number is 1-866-246-6893.
* The maximum email file size is 15 megabytes.

## Procurement Process

This is a competitive bid process, open to all eligible suppliers. The contract will be awarded to the supplier offering the best price and that has the capability to perform the required tasks.

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

## Important Notes

* National Parks Regulations require that all work is to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
* Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements apply to Region G.
* Documents may be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service through the Government of Canada tendering service at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities. Addenda, when issued, will be available from the Government of Canada tendering service. Suppliers should verify that the documents downloaded are current.

Contact Information
-----------------

For more information, contact Andrea McGraw-Alcock at andrea.mcgraw-alcock@
